definition: to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street

sentences.english: And there are tons and tons of pieces of script pages and scribbled notes.
sentences.chinese: 還有成噸成噸的劇本及塗寫的筆記。

sentences.english: Painting, writing on wall or machine and disturbing other work with concrete evidence.
sentences.chinese: 塗寫牆壁機器，有礙觀瞻，且具體事實者。

sentences.english: She defaced the book by writing on it.
sentences.chinese: 在書上亂塗寫而損壞了書本。

sentences.english: "Too many tunnels!" I scribble on the breakfast menu.
sentences.chinese: “太多的隧道，”我在早餐菜單上塗寫着。

sentences.english: I doodled it on my to-do lists and wrote it in my journal.
sentences.chinese: 我把它塗寫在待辦事項清單上，把它寫進日記裏。

sentences.english: Visigoth would merely scrawl obscenities on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 西哥特人將只會在牆壁上塗寫一些淫穢下流的話。

sentences.english: If you find me scrawling on a piece of paper. please don't peep over my shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 當我在紙上胡亂塗寫的時候，請不要在我身後窺視。
